intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: We really pulverized those dastards back there, Soleil!

intro.speaker: Soleil
intro.line: Nice work! We chased off those bandits. Did you see 'em run?! Yipe, yipe, yipe! Tails between their legs?! Dirty dogs. And who's the best town watch in this or any other world? Us! That's who!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Wait up. What was that about yipe, yipe, yipe?

intro.speaker: Soleil
intro.line: Hmm? Back for more, eh?

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: We didn't run. We were just calling some friends to this little party.

intro.speaker: Soleil
intro.line: Uh, what?

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: Ma'am! There are too many of them. No way we can take them all on!

intro.speaker: Soleil
intro.line: Come on! Turn that frown upside down. Know what you have then? A smile! That's what my father taught me. If you can't smile? Stand on your head! That'll turn your frown upside—

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Heh! What a crock. Let's see if you're still smiling once my friends get the best of you. Men, ATTACK!

intro.speaker: Soleil
intro.line: BRING! IT ! ON!

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: I guess the report was false. Seems pretty calm here. That's fine by me. One night off from coming to the rescue? Perfect. Maybe we can get a little rest and relaxation while we're here...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Hey! Listen up. trouble's brewing. The town watch chased off some bandits. But they returned with friends. And more are coming. This town's about to be sacked.

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: What? Then we've got to get in there and help!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Yes, let's. The town watch is in way over their heads. Though it's said they have a skilled mercenary leading them. She's also got the happiest band of me I've ever seen—they're all smiles!

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: Hmm? I wonder who she is? All smiles, you say? Uh-oh. It can't be...Soleil?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Yes, that's her name. So you know this girl? I can't believe she'd dare come to such a dread place as this.

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: You don't know my daughter. She doesn’t' get the chills easily.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: What?! Soleil is your daughter? But isn't your child off in her Deeprealm?

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: Well, she should be. But Soleil is her own woman—like a force of nature. She's gathered a band of do-gooders around her. She's just like that. But Soleil and her men shouldn't be here. These bandits mean business.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Wait, Laslow! Are you sure that this Soleil is your daughter? We can't just run in—it could be some sort of trap!

recruit-talk.speaker: Soleil
recruit-talk.line: Always! I am your daughter, after all. Nothing ever gets to me! Not even these bandits! Well, I mean... Maybe I was worried. But only a... Only a...

recruit-talk.speaker: Soleil
recruit-talk.line: OK. I'll admit it. This is bad. And I can't bring myself to tell my men.

recruit-talk.speaker: Laslow
recruit-talk.line: Soleil, I know I always said to keep on smiling. But sometimes it's fine to drop it if it feels like an act. Still, you'll have to forgive me if I smile, looking at you here. You've grown into such a hero! Let me share one of my secrets. If battle is turning against me... And I can't smile? I laugh. A lot. It really confuses the enemy. Then I get the upper hand, and I'm smiling again before I know it!

recruit-talk.speaker: Laslow
recruit-talk.line: See? There's that smile again. An honest smile. Nothing lovelier. Ready to smile? Laugh? Whatever it takes out there to win?

boss.speaker: Zhara
boss.line: You don't know me. I don't know you. But before I was a bandit...? I was a swordsman. The best! Come on—I'll test my blade on you.

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Soleil, you were amazing.

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Wahooo! Thanks, Father. And thanks to all your friends. I'm so happy that you came.

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: I'm happy that you're alive. This was no piece of cake.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Um, if I may? We could use someone like her—fighting with a smile on her face. We're always on such a grim march. She'd put some pep in our step.

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Huh? Aren't I smiley enough?

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Yaaay! I'd love to come! You have to let me, Father. You HAVE to!

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Well, um...

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Once more, Laslow? I couldn't hear you through your frown.

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Um...all right. I could use some extra support on the smiley front.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Hmmm? Who's this?

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Thank you, Soleil! Our town would be a pile of rocks if you hadn't helped! Here, something to remember us by!

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Oh! My goodness...

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Um, what's with the blushing? You're pink as a rose, Soleil.

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Wow. Cute! Um...hi! Again. Did I say hi? Sorry. Blanked out there. You're just too pretty for words. But I guess those are words. About you being pretty.

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Hmm, I am?

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Let's go stargazing. Shall we? Do you want to? Just the two of us?

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Yes! I'd love to!

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Whoa. Really? You and me, beneath the stars? I can't wait!

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Hmm, Laslow, did your daughter just ask that girl out to gaze at the stars?

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Why, yes! She's got good taste. In women as well as men—got a problem with that?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: No, of course not.

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: Wahooo! She said yes, Father! See, I always told you—be honest with women. It's not a game. Just wear your heart on your sleeve. On BOTH your sleeves!

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: Soleil...I guess I can look forward to more of these dating tips, eh?

end.speaker: Soleil
end.line: I don't imagine we'll have much time for these little daughter-father chats. But you can always rely on me!

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: It's true. We're at war. But I'll always have time for you, Soleil.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: What a breath of fresh air. How'd someone like YOU end up with a great daughter?

end.speaker: Laslow
end.line: What do you mean, ME? But, yes. I suppose I am fortunate to have such a delight as Soleil in my life!
